When an author, copyeditor or editor uploads a new version (DOC/DOCX/ODT/PDF format) of an article, this module submits it to the document markup server specified in the settings. It then receives a zipfile containing formatted XML, HTML and PDF versions of the article, as well as bibliographic information automatically styled per the journal's guidelines. This zipfile is kept in the supplementary files folder for the editors during the review process. When ready to publish the article, the HTML, XML, and PDF galley files are automatically extracted and made available from the journal table of contents.

PHP curl needs to be installed on your server. This plugin uses curl to send the article files to the Document Markup Server service for processing.

This plugin can use a guest account (limited to 10 conversions per week) or log in for unlimited use. Leave the User ID field blank for guest account use. For more information, visit PKP Document Markup Service.
